results.title: New cords for old, and the golden rule
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Instructional Films for S E C
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electricity Safety”.
Do not keep old damaged electrical cords, and never try to repair them. Common causes of accidents are frayed cords, and badly repaired cords, broken plugs, and two cord flexes used instead of three cord flexes. Once insulation becomes worn or damaged wires are exposed which may cause shocks. Hows correct way of wiring new plugs and recommends that it is a job for an expert.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lex Halliday, Australian Instructional Films and Instructional Films for S E C

results.title: New China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the main developments in China since 1949 - collectivization of land, the communes, the Great Leap Forward, plans for production, the Cultural Revolution and the Red Guard movement.

results.title: New chapters
results.brief_description: Shows the part a public library can play as a workshop, lecture hall and resource centre for the planned cultural activity of the community. Particular emphasis is placed on the provision of facilities for children’s activities in the field of art, music, story telling and play reading. Other activities mentioned include exhibitions, film loans and screenings, play readings and forum discussions on world affairs.

results.title: New Channels for Sockeye
results.brief_description: The multimillion dollar Babine Lake Salmon Development Program in northern British Colombia is an impressive illustration of what can be done to improve on nature by establishing sockeye salmon stocks where none were found before.

results.title: New Caledonia
results.brief_description: Seven hundred miles east of the Australian coast lies the French island possession of New Caledonia. The capital Noumea, is a pleasant tropical town with modern shops and Parisian street cafes, native markets and wide beaches. The island is rich in high-grade nickel ore, and in the mountains inland from Noumea the ore is mined and conveyed in an aerial conveyor to smelting works on the coast, where the nickel is extracted and exported. From the series “Pacific on parade”.

results.title: New breath of life. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Bob Berk, Frank Gardonyi, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Revised version of Film no 505488. Shows first aid techniques to use when people are choking. Notes the methods of opening the airway, dislodging foreign objects, and mouth-to-mouth breathing.

results.title: New breath of life
results.brief_description: Shows new methods for opening the airway and relieving choking and obstruction by the tongue during unconsciousness. Follows latest recommendations of the National Research Council. American Heart Association and American Red Cross. Provides instruction in performing artificial respiration.
